snippet: In Texas’s long legal battle over its sweeping abortion law, an appeals court gave the state permission to require clinics to meet the same standards as hospital-style surgical centers.
abstract: Thirteen abortion clinics in Texas are forced to close immediately after federal appellate court sides with state in its yearlong battle over sweeping abortion law; ruling allows state to enforce requirement that all abortion clinics meet same standards as hospital-style surgical centers, one of law's toughest provisions, while case is being appealed.
lead_paragraph: In Texas’s long legal battle over its sweeping abortion law, an appeals court gave the state permission to require clinics to meet the same standards as hospital-style surgical centers.

headline.main: Decision Allows Abortion Law, Forcing 13 Texas Clinics to Close
headline.print_headline: Decision Allows Abortion Law, Forcing 13 Texas Clinics to Close
